author: Special Correspondent
text:
Nodal officers taking part in the election training programme for the ensuing Assembly elections in Madurai on Monday.— Photo: R. Ashok

A two-day training programme for nodal officers for the ensuing Assembly Elections from eight southern districts about various processes of elections began here on Monday.

Sixty four nodal officers, in the rank of Tahsildars and Deputy Collectors, from Madurai, Theni, Virudhunagar, Sivaganga, Ramanathapuram, Tirunelveli, Tuticorin and Kanyakumari took part in the training programme.

Master trainers, who had undergone training in Chennai, provided training to the nodal officers on all aspects related to election works starting from notification of election till counting of votes, said Sub-Collector of Paramakudi, G.S. Sameeran.

The training would cover 16 topics including implementation of model code of conduct, maintenance of law and order, preparation of ballot papers, electoral rolls and media communication among others, the Revenue Divisional Officer (Madurai), M. Senthilkumari, said. Dr. Sameeran said that it was only the first of training programme that would continue till the Assembly elections.
title: Assembly polls: training for nodal officers begins
